title: AIML - Director of Business Operations
summary: Are you a business or operations professional passionate about driving efficiency and creating forward-looking strategies in a fast-paced, innovative environment? The AIML PM team is seeking a dynamic Director of Business Operations to join our organization and significantly accelerate Apple’s overall AIML strategy.
description:
- Manage a small but high-performing operations team
- Develop and implement cost optimization strategies across the organization
- Manage compute resources to ensure efficient utilization and cost-effectiveness
- Conduct comprehensive technical analyses to identify areas for improvement
- Communicate insights and recommendations to executive teams and partners
- Foster a culture of discipline and accountability throughout the organization
- Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in operations and AI development 
- Align teams across Apple on a strategic vision to advance ML across our products, software, and services
key_qualifications:
Deep understanding of compute management and cost optimization strategies
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex cost-optimization concepts to non-finance partners
Proven track record of driving efficiency and cost savings in a fast-paced environment
preferred_qualifications:
Working understanding of the accelerator landscape across the industry
Understanding of and experience with implementing cost optimization strategies
Knowledge of modern machine learning technologies, frameworks, and development methodologies
education_experience: Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration, or a related field; MBA or relevant advanced degree preferred
pay_benefits: At Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $284,900 and $455,200, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location.Apple employees also have the opportunity to become an Apple shareholder through participation in Apple’s discretionary employee stock programs. Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, and can purchase Apple stock at a discount if voluntarily participating in Apple’s Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You’ll also receive benefits including: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses — including tuition. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary bonuses or commission payments as well as relocation. Learn more about Apple Benefits.
